rank_test.cpp

Determines the numerical rank of the symmetric matrix "amatA". Given the matrix amatA, this function uses the eigenvectors vmatA and the eigenvalues dvecA to calculate the rank of amatA. For the calculation of the eigenvectors and eigenvalues see also eigensymm(const Array2D<double> &amatA,Array2D<double> &vmatA,Array<double> &dvecA).

Parameters:
amatA  matrix, which is symmetric and is not changed by the function.
vmatA  matrix with the normalized eigenvectors, each column contains one eigenvector. The matrix is not changed by the function.
dvecA n-dimensional vector of the eigenvalues, given in descending order. The vector is not changed by the function.
Returns:
The rank of matrix amatA.
Exceptions:
check_exception the type of the exception will be "size mismatch" and indicates that dvecA is not one-dimensional or that amatA or vmatA has not the same number of rows or columns than dvecA contains values
Please follow the link to view the source code of the example. The example can be executed in the example directory of package LinAlg.

Author:
M. Kreutz
Date:
1995
Changes
none
Status
stable

00053 #include <iostream>
00054 #include "Array/ArrayIo.h"
00055 #include "LinAlg/linalg.h"
00056 
00057 using namespace std;
00058 
00059 int main() 
00060 {
00061     Array2D< double > A(3,3);    // input matrix
00062     Array2D< double > x(3,3);    // matrix for eigenvectors
00063     Array  < double > lambda(3); // vector for eigenvalues
00064     unsigned          curr_row,  // currently considered matrix
00065                       curr_col,  // row/column
00066                       r;         // rank of the matrix
00067 
00068     // Initialization values for input matrix:
00069     double bottom_triangle[9] = 
00070     { 
00071          7.,  0.,  0., 
00072 
00073         -2.,  6.,  0., 
00074 
00075          0., -2.,  0. 
00076     };
00077 
00078     // Initializing matrices and vector:
00079     for (curr_row = 0; curr_row < 3; curr_row++)
00080     {
00081         for (curr_col = 0; curr_col < 3; curr_col++)
00082         {
00083                 A(curr_row, curr_col) = bottom_triangle[curr_row*3+curr_col];
00084                 x(curr_row, curr_col) = 0.;
00085         }
00086             lambda(curr_row) = 0.;
00087     }
00088 
00089     // Output of input matrix:
00090     cout << "input matrix:" << endl;
00091     writeArray( A, cout);
00092 
00093     // Calculating eigenvalues and eigenvectors:
00094     //eigensymm(A, x, lambda);// A is unchanged after the call
00095     eigensymm_obsolete(A, x, lambda);// A is corrupted after the call
00096 
00097     // Calculating the rank of the matrix:
00098     r = rank(A, x, lambda);
00099 
00100     // Output of rank:
00101     cout << "rank of matrix is " << r << endl;
00102 
00103     return 0;
00104 }
